dialog:
Hello
Hello, how are you doing today?
I was looking for some assistance. I lost my job 4 month ago 
Losing your job is one of the biggest stressors in life, how have you been handling it?
Well first few month was kind off alright, Was looking for a job in different places without success. And now I am really depressed and I feel so useless.
I know what it's like to lose a job, and when it's hard to find a new one it can really make you feel low. What activities have you been doing in addition to seeking new employment?
Nice that you understand me, I was trying job websites alongside with jobcenter in town centre. I have jobseeker allowance but it will not cover the rent
I am living in a high-rent city and the only way I was able to keep my apartment was to find a roommate. Are there ways you can get help from friends or family until a new job opens up?
I am renting just a room at the moment, Before I had a girlfriend so we had to split the bill. After she left I had to take all responsibility just on myself to pay bills. I have few friends but don't think they could lend me a lot of money anyway
One possible solution, if it's possible for you, could be to sub-lease your room to someone else and stay with friends or family. Even if they can't loan you money, they may be able to let you stay with them for a week while you make money renting your room as an airbnb.
Oh AirBnB might be a solution actually. I will speak to my cousin if I could stay couple of nights at his place.
What sort of employment are you looking for? Perhaps we can brainstorm some places you can go to make connections for potential work.
I was working in IKEA warehouse before I got redundant
Working in a warehouse shows you have great skills for several other types of jobs. Have you checked small independent-contractor sites like TaskRabbit or Lyft to make extra funds while you search for a new permanent job?
I even haven't heard about those. I am really useless sometimes... What kind of jobs I can find there do you know?
situation: I lost my job 4 month ago and I am running out of money.

responses.Affirmation: you're not alone in this struggle, and it takes a lot of courage to reach out for help. it's great that you're open to exploring different options. taskrabbit and lyft are platforms that allow you to work as an independent contractor, offering services like errand running, delivery, and transportation. you can create a profile, set your own rates, and start getting hired by people in your area. it's a great way to make some extra money while you continue your job search. and hey, you've already shown great resourcefulness by considering airbnb, so i'm sure you'll figure out what works best for you. keep pushing forward, and remember that you're not alone in this.
responses.Avoid Judgment and Criticism: it's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed and unsure of where to turn when facing a difficult situation like job loss. it's important to remember that everyone goes through tough times, and it's okay to ask for help. taskrabbit and lyft are great options for making some extra money while you're searching for a new permanent job. taskrabbit is a platform that connects people who need help with errands, tasks, and other jobs with people who are willing to do them. lyft is a ride-sharing service that allows you to make money by driving people around. both are great ways to make some extra money on your own schedule. it's also a good idea to check out local job listings and reach out to staffing agencies in your area to see if they have any openings that might be a good fit for you. remember, it's okay to take things one step at a time and ask for help when you need it.
responses.Clarification: just to clarify, you mentioned that you've been feeling depressed and useless since losing your job, and you're running out of money. have you considered reaching out to a therapist or counselor to talk through your feelings and get support during this challenging time? additionally, have you explored government assistance programs or non-profit organizations that may be able to provide temporary financial aid or job training?
responses.Collaborative Planning: let's take a look together. taskrabbit is a platform that connects people who need help with errands, tasks, and other jobs with people who are willing to do them. you can create a profile, set your own rates, and apply for tasks that fit your skills and availability. lyft is a ride-sharing service that allows you to make money by driving passengers. both platforms can be a great way to make some extra money while you're looking for a new job. shall we brainstorm some other ways to make money while you search for a new job?
responses.Share Information: taskrabbit and lyft are great resources for finding temporary or freelance work. taskrabbit is a platform that connects people who need help with errands, tasks, and other jobs with people who are willing to do them. you can create a profile, set your own rates, and apply for tasks that fit your skills and availability. lyft is a ride-sharing service that allows you to make money by driving passengers around. both platforms offer flexible schedules and the opportunity to make extra money while you're looking for a new permanent job.
responses.Stress Management: have you tried deep breathing or mindfulness exercises to manage stress? it can be helpful to take a few minutes each day to focus on your breath and calm your mind. additionally, creating a regular routine can sometimes help in reducing stress levels. for example, you could try to exercise regularly, such as going for a walk or jog, or practicing yoga. exercise can be a great way to relieve stress and improve mood.
